content:
HttpCachePolicyWrapper Class

In this Article

Encapsulates the HTTP intrinsic object that contains methods for setting cache-specific HTTP headers and for controlling the ASP.NET page output cache.

Syntax

Declaration

public class HttpCachePolicyWrapper : System.Web.HttpCachePolicyBase

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.Web.HttpCachePolicyBase
  • HttpCachePolicyWrapper

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Remarks

The HttpCachePolicyWrapper class derives from the HttpCachePolicyBase class and serves as a wrapper for the HttpCachePolicy class. This class exposes the functionality of the HttpCachePolicy class while also exposing the HttpCachePolicyBase type. The HttpCachePolicyBase class enables you to replace the original implementation of the HttpCachePolicy class in your application with a custom implementation, such as when you perform unit testing outside the ASP.NET pipeline.

Constructors summary

HttpCachePolicyWrapper(HttpCachePolicy)

Initializes a new instance of the HttpCachePolicyWrapper class.

Properties summary

VaryByContentEncodings

Gets the list of Content-Encoding headers that will be used to vary the output cache.
VaryByHeaders

Gets the list of all HTTP headers that will be used to vary cache output.
VaryByParams

Gets the list of parameters received by an HTTP GET or HTTP POST that affect caching.

Methods summary

AddValidationCallback(HttpCacheValidateHandler,Object)

Registers a validation callback for the current response.
AppendCacheExtension(String)

Appends the specified text to the Cache-Control HTTP header.
SetAllowResponseInBrowserHistory(Boolean)

Makes the response available in the browser history cache, regardless of the HttpCacheability setting made on the server.
SetCacheability(HttpCacheability)

Sets the Cache-Control header to the specified HttpCacheability value.
SetCacheability(HttpCacheability,String)

Sets the Cache-Control header to the specified HttpCacheability value and appends an extension to the directive.
SetETag(String)

Sets the ETag HTTP header to the specified string.
SetETagFromFileDependencies()

Sets the ETag HTTP header based on the time stamps of the handler's file dependencies.
SetExpires(DateTime)

Sets the Expires HTTP header to an absolute date and time.
SetLastModified(DateTime)

Sets the Last-Modified HTTP header to the specified date and time.
SetLastModifiedFromFileDependencies()

Sets the Last-Modified HTTP header based on the time stamps of the handler's file dependencies.
SetMaxAge(TimeSpan)

Sets the Cache-Control: max-age HTTP header to the specified time span.
SetNoServerCaching()

Stops all origin-server caching for the current response.
SetNoStore()

Sets the Cache-Control: no-store HTTP header.
SetNoTransforms()

Sets the Cache-Control: no-transform HTTP header.
SetOmitVaryStar(Boolean)

Specifies whether the response contains the vary:* header when varying by parameters.
SetProxyMaxAge(TimeSpan)

Sets the Cache-Control: s-maxage HTTP header to the specified time span.
SetRevalidation(HttpCacheRevalidation)

Sets the Cache-Control HTTP header to either the must-revalidate or the proxy-revalidate directives, based on the specified enumeration value.
SetSlidingExpiration(Boolean)

Sets cache expiration to absolute or sliding.
SetValidUntilExpires(Boolean)

Specifies whether the ASP.NET cache should ignore HTTP Cache-Control headers sent by the client that invalidate the cache.
SetVaryByCustom(String)

Specifies a text string to vary cached output responses by.

Constructors

  • HttpCachePolicyWrapper(HttpCachePolicy)

    Initializes a new instance of the HttpCachePolicyWrapper class.

    public HttpCachePolicyWrapper (System.Web.HttpCachePolicy httpCachePolicy);

    Parameters

    • httpCachePolicy
      HttpCachePolicy

      The object that this wrapper class provides access to.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      httpCachePolicy is null.

Properties

  • VaryByContentEncodings

    Gets the list of Content-Encoding headers that will be used to vary the output cache.

    public override System.Web.HttpCacheVaryByContentEncodings VaryByContentEncodings { get; }

    Property Value

    • HttpCacheVaryByContentEncodings

      An object that specifies which Content-Encoding headers are used to select the cached response.

  • VaryByHeaders

    Gets the list of all HTTP headers that will be used to vary cache output.

    public override System.Web.HttpCacheVaryByHeaders VaryByHeaders { get; }

    Property Value

    • HttpCacheVaryByHeaders

      An object that specifies which HTTP headers are used to select the cached response.

  • VaryByParams

    Gets the list of parameters received by an HTTP GET or HTTP POST that affect caching.

    public override System.Web.HttpCacheVaryByParams VaryByParams { get; }

    Property Value

    • HttpCacheVaryByParams

      An object that specifies which cache-control parameters are used to select the cached response.

Methods

  • AddValidationCallback(HttpCacheValidateHandler,Object)

    Registers a validation callback for the current response.

    public override void AddValidationCallback (System.Web.HttpCacheValidateHandler handler, object data);

    Parameters

    • handler
      HttpCacheValidateHandler

      The object that will handle the request.

    • data
      Object

      The user-supplied data that is passed to the AddValidationCallback delegate.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      The specified handler is null.

  • AppendCacheExtension(String)

    Appends the specified text to the Cache-Control HTTP header.

    public override void AppendCacheExtension (string extension);

    Parameters

    • extension
      String

      The text to append to the Cache-Control header.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      extension is null.

  • SetAllowResponseInBrowserHistory(Boolean)

    Makes the response available in the browser history cache, regardless of the HttpCacheability setting made on the server.

    public override void SetAllowResponseInBrowserHistory (bool allow);

    Parameters

    • allow
      Boolean

      true to direct the client browser to store responses in the browser history cache; otherwise false. The default is false.

  • SetCacheability(HttpCacheability)

    Sets the Cache-Control header to the specified HttpCacheability value.

    public override void SetCacheability (System.Web.HttpCacheability cacheability);

    Parameters

    • cacheability
      HttpCacheability

      The HttpCacheability enumeration value to set the header to.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      cacheability is not one of the enumeration values.

  • SetCacheability(HttpCacheability,String)

    Sets the Cache-Control header to the specified HttpCacheability value and appends an extension to the directive.

    public override void SetCacheability (System.Web.HttpCacheability cacheability, string field);

    Parameters

    • cacheability
      HttpCacheability

      The HttpCacheability enumeration value to set the header to.

    • field
      String

      The cache-control extension to add to the header.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      field is null.

    • ArgumentException

      cacheability is not HttpCacheability or HttpCacheability.

  • SetETag(String)

    Sets the ETag HTTP header to the specified string.

    public override void SetETag (string etag);

    Parameters

    • etag
      String

      The text to use for the ETag header.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      etag is null.

    • InvalidOperationException

      The ETag header has already been set.

      - or -

      The stem.Web.HttpCachePolicy.SetETagFromFileDependencies* method has already been called.

  • SetETagFromFileDependencies()

    Sets the ETag HTTP header based on the time stamps of the handler's file dependencies.

    public override void SetETagFromFileDependencies ();

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      The ETag header has already been set.

  • SetExpires(DateTime)

    Sets the Expires HTTP header to an absolute date and time.

    public override void SetExpires (DateTime date);

    Parameters

    • date
      DateTime

      The absolute expiration time.

  • SetLastModified(DateTime)

    Sets the Last-Modified HTTP header to the specified date and time.

    public override void SetLastModified (DateTime date);

    Parameters

    • date
      DateTime

      The date-time value to set the Last-Modified header to.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      date is later than the current DateTime.

  • SetLastModifiedFromFileDependencies()

    Sets the Last-Modified HTTP header based on the time stamps of the handler's file dependencies.

    public override void SetLastModifiedFromFileDependencies ();
  • SetMaxAge(TimeSpan)

    Sets the Cache-Control: max-age HTTP header to the specified time span.

    public override void SetMaxAge (TimeSpan delta);

    Parameters

    • delta
      TimeSpan

      The time span to set the Cache-Control: max-age header to.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      delta is less than 0 or greater than one year.

  • SetNoServerCaching()

    Stops all origin-server caching for the current response.

    public override void SetNoServerCaching ();
  • SetNoStore()

    Sets the Cache-Control: no-store HTTP header.

    public override void SetNoStore ();
  • SetNoTransforms()

    Sets the Cache-Control: no-transform HTTP header.

    public override void SetNoTransforms ();
  • SetOmitVaryStar(Boolean)

    Specifies whether the response contains the vary:* header when varying by parameters.

    public override void SetOmitVaryStar (bool omit);

    Parameters

    • omit
      Boolean

      true to direct the HttpCachePolicy object to not use the * value for its stem.Web.HttpCachePolicy.VaryByHeaders* property; otherwise, false.

  • SetProxyMaxAge(TimeSpan)

    Sets the Cache-Control: s-maxage HTTP header to the specified time span.

    public override void SetProxyMaxAge (TimeSpan delta);

    Parameters

    • delta
      TimeSpan

      The time span to set the Cache-Control: s-maxage header to.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      delta is less than 0.

  • SetRevalidation(HttpCacheRevalidation)

    Sets the Cache-Control HTTP header to either the must-revalidate or the proxy-revalidate directives, based on the specified enumeration value.

    public override void SetRevalidation (System.Web.HttpCacheRevalidation revalidation);

    Parameters

    • revalidation
      HttpCacheRevalidation

      The HttpCacheRevalidation enumeration value to set the Cache-Control header to.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      revalidation is not one of the enumeration values.

  • SetSlidingExpiration(Boolean)

    Sets cache expiration to absolute or sliding.

    public override void SetSlidingExpiration (bool slide);

    Parameters

    • slide
      Boolean

      true to set a sliding cache expiration, and false to set an absolute cache expiration.

  • SetValidUntilExpires(Boolean)

    Specifies whether the ASP.NET cache should ignore HTTP Cache-Control headers sent by the client that invalidate the cache.

    public override void SetValidUntilExpires (bool validUntilExpires);

    Parameters

    • validUntilExpires
      Boolean

      true to specify that ASP.NET should ignore Cache-Control invalidation headers; otherwise, false.

  • SetVaryByCustom(String)

    Specifies a text string to vary cached output responses by.

    public override void SetVaryByCustom (string custom);

    Parameters

    • custom
      String

      The text string to vary cached output by.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      custom is null.

    • InvalidOperationException

      The stem.Web.HttpCachePolicy.SetVaryByCustom* method has already been called.
